articles.title: Fitness earlier in life reduces cancer risk when older, study shows - The Guardian
articles.description: Data from more than 1 million males between 16 and 25 over five decades shows cardiorespiratory fitness can reduce risk up to 42%
articles.content:
Being fit earlier in life is associated with a reduced risk, in some cases of up to 42%, of developing nine different types of cancer in later life, according to a large long-term study.
